channel.title: New music: Chaos Out Of Nothingness (Post-Rock / Progressive Rock)
channel.description:
I have a huge appreciation for Post Rock and Progressive Rock music. I borrow from their ideas quite often. I haven’t really done a full on track in either genre though. Making Contact is the closest I’ve come to making a Progressive Rock or Post-Rock track.
Chaos Out Of Nothingness comes much closer. Layers of guitars, bass, drums, piano and ambience that build up slowly to the big finale. Not too slow of a buildup though, cause I get bored when the build-up is several minutes long. :stuck_out_tongue:
[b]Download:[/b] [url='https://www.hamsteralliance.com/music/2009/THA-chaosoutofnothingness.mp3'][b]THA – Chaos Out Of Nothingness[/b][/url]
Enjoy. :mono:
Oh and visual AIDS: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mEeUpHU46Jc&fmt=22]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mEeUpHU46Jc&fmt=22[/url] - The song accompanied by visuals from the game rRootage.

item.title: New music: Chaos Out Of Nothingness (Post-Rock / Progressive Rock)
item.dc:creator: _amp_955_dam
item.description:
Keresh:

Pretty good piece. For some reason it reminds me of “28 days/weeks later” movie.

I asked him to base it off of the In A Heartbeat song from those films. :3

It is a very nice piece.
I have to say it does sound like it’s out of a horror or thriller film.

I have a huge appreciation for Post Rock and Progressive Rock music. I borrow from their ideas quite often. I haven’t really done a full on track in either genre though. Making Contact is the closest I’ve come to making a Progressive Rock or Post-Rock track.

Chaos Out Of Nothingness comes much closer. Layers of guitars, bass, drums, piano and ambience that build up slowly to the big finale. Not too slow of a buildup though, cause I get bored when the build-up is several minutes long.
